perturbation.original_text: THIS FRANCHISE DEVELOPMENT AGREEMENT ("Agreement") dated for identification purposes only as of _____________________, is made and entered into by and between EL POLLO LOCO, INC., a Delaware corporation, with its principal place of business at 3535 Harbor Blvd, Suite 100, Costa Mesa, California 92626 (referred to herein as "El Pollo Loco" or "Franchisor") and __________________an individual, with its principal place of business at _____________________________________ ("Developer").
perturbation.changed_text: THIS FRANCHISE DEVELOPMENT AGREEMENT ("Agreement") dated for identification purposes only as of _____________________, is made and entered into by and between EL POLLO LOCO, INC., a Delaware corporation, with its principal place of business at 3535 Harbor Blvd, Suite 100, Costa Mesa, California 92626 (referred to herein as "El Pollo Loco" or "Licensor") and __________________an individual, with its principal place of business at _____________________________________ ("Developer").
perturbation.explanation: Changed "Franchisor" to "Licensor" in the introductory paragraph. This creates confusion as the rest of the document refers to El Pollo Loco as the Franchisor, and the definition of their role is now ambiguous. It is unclear if the parties are referring to the same entity or two separate entities, particularly when dealing with obligations related to franchising.

perturbation.original_text: 2.4. Developer must satisfy all Franchisor's financial and operational criteria then in effect and in addition, if Developer is also a Franchisee of one or more El Pollo Loco Restaurants, Franchisee must also be in good standing with Franchisor and satisfy all Franchisor's financial and operational criteria then in effect prior to El Pollo Loco's execution of each standard Franchise Agreement issued pursuant to this Agreement. Developer shall provide Franchisor with current information pertaining to Developer's financial condition and the financial condition of the majority and managing members/partners/shareholders of Developer at any time upon El Pollo Loco's request and in no event less than once annually.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.4. Developer must satisfy all Franchisor's financial and operational criteria then in effect and in addition, if Developer is also a Licensee of one or more El Pollo Loco Restaurants, Franchisee must also be in good standing with Franchisor and satisfy all Franchisor's financial and operational criteria then in effect prior to El Pollo Loco's execution of each standard Franchise Agreement issued pursuant to this Agreement. Developer shall provide Licensor with current information pertaining to Developer's financial condition and the financial condition of the majority and managing members/partners/shareholders of Developer at any time upon El Pollo Loco's request and in no event less than once annually.
perturbation.explanation: In Section 2.4, I replaced 'Franchisee' with 'Licensee' and 'Franchisor' with 'Licensor'. This creates confusion because it is not explicitly stated if a 'Licensee' is the same as a 'Franchisee'. Also, it is unclear whether the term 'Licensor' has a direct relationship with the already defined term 'Franchisor'. This creates uncertainty when determining financial and operational standards.

In Section 9.1, I replaced 'Franchise Agreement' with 'License Agreement' at the start and 'Franchisor' with 'Licensor'. Now 'License Agreement' and 'franchise agreement' are used in the same sentences. Because both terms are used interchangeably, questions arise as to what obligations developers must meet. It also does not explicitly say if the agreements are different.
